Rista is a famous dish of kashmiri wazwan. It is prepared in red chilly powder and other spices. Rista is made with mutton meat balls simmered in a red spicy gravy.

Two Wheeler Vehicles ‘Barbecue’ is a special non-vegetarian recipe that is prepared by smoking or baking chopped meat pieces over slow-burning wood or charcoal. Popularly known as seek-e-tujj in Kashmir.
Gushtaba is a dish of minced mutton balls cooked in curd and spices. This traditional Kashmiri dish is prepared in important ceremonies and functions.
‘Barbecue’ is a special non-vegetarian recipe that is prepared by smoking or baking chopped meat pieces over slow-burning wood or charcoal. Popularly known as seek-e-tujj in Kashmir.
It is a staple Kashmiri dish and a cultural identification in cooking Kashmiri Cuisine.It is known for its bitter sharp taste. These greens are simply cooked, yet taste heavenly.
Kashmiri kebab is a popular dish in Kashmir. It is eaten as a snack or meal with rice or bread made of wheat. Its aromatic flavor and delicious taste makes it a favorite the world over.
Noon chai, also called sheer chai, gulabi chai, Kashmiri tea or pink tea, is a traditional tea beverage from Kashmir made with salt, milk, baking soda and special tea leaves.
Mutton Rogan Josh is scrumptious delicacy from the Kashmiri cuisine distinguished by its thick, aromatic, flavourful red sauce and tender meat.
Czot is a medium sized everyday bread. Everyone has it for breakfast with butter or jam. It is prepared in tandoor (hot oven). It is golden on the upper side and white from below.
Kashmiri Yakhni is a yoghurt based gravy. It also contains saffron. The silky smooth curry with falling-off-the-bone meat is an absolute treat.
Near Harwan Mughal Garden, Dachigam Road, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 191202

Shalimar, Rainawari, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190025
Srinagar is undoubtedly one of the most beautiful places to visit in Kashmir. From boating to trekking, bird watching to water skiing, Srinagar place has it all.
Famously known as the ‘Meadow of Flowers’, Gulmarg is a treat to the eyes. Mountain Biking, trekking, Skiing and Gondola rides are some of the things to do here.
Sonamarg is known as the ‘Meadow of Gold’. An endless stream of flowers and trekking routes are its attractions. Sonamarg is known for its mesmerizing aura and breathtaking views.
Clad in the beauty and love of nature, Leh offers breathtaking views. The lofty mountains, the alpine lakes, and the quaint settings leave no visitor disappointed.
Brave heart Kargil is situated at India-Pakistan border at an altitude of approximately 2800m above sea level. Connected to the Zojila Pass, Kargil holds important place in the history of India.
Tranquility and serenity are the other names of Phalagam! The green meadows and the lofty mountains of this tiny town is known to suck out all the stress of every visitor.
An unexplored destinations, situated on the western bank of River Indus, this small village is famed for its prestigious monastery and a national park, better known as Hemis National Park.
Anantnag is rightly the paradise in paradise! Strategically positioned and organized, adorned with flourishing gardens and freshwater springs, Anantnag is a divine destination.
Pangong lake is famous for its azure water and its picture perfect surroundings. The marshy area in the vicinity of the lake is a shelter for many indigenous and migratory birds.
Lose yourself in the beauty of sprawling saffron fields and the rich culture that dwells here. Pulwama gives quite a large number of places for sightseeing.
Noted for natural beauty and charm, Kupwara has lush meadows, alpine mountains and the gushing clear water. Visiting Lolab valley and Bungus valley are some of the best things to do here.
Reckoned to be the Gateway of Kashmir, Baramulla is generously blessed with natural endowments. Where Gulmarg is an idyllic skiing resort, there Khilanmarg is a flower-spangled wide valley.
Kashmir offers a unique opportunity to play golf all through the summer where the wind whispers through enormous trees of chinar and stately pine in such heavenly temperatures.
One of the major attractions for adventure loving tourists is skiing in the Himalayas. Gulmarg\'s atmosphere can generally be identified with 1940\'s and 50\'s European skiing.
Kashmir\'s natural advantages are its mountains, lakes and rivers. But more than just a means of pleasure, the waterways are a way of discovering new leisure sports.
Playing Cricket in kashmir is a treat because of the soothing weather. You can find people playing cricket in every part of the valley at almost any time of the year.
